title.narrative: Provide seasonal and supplementary NFI assistance and CCCM services for the most vulnerable in North of Syria

description.narrative:
Takaful through this project aims to meet the basic needs of heating items to the most vulnerable in Idleb and Aleppo camps by providing them with seasonal NFIs through restricted e-vouchers for 3 months in addition to establish fire points and raising awareness about the fire hazards, prevention and mitigation procedures in the same camps . The project will target 3233 HHs 16165 individuals (3718 men 3880 women 4849 boys 3718 girls) as follow:
Azaz 1409 HHs (Alrayan) Camp Dana 1185 HHs (Al Salam, Al-Ahmad, Abnaa alziara, Al Wdahee, Aldarraj, Maarrat Dibsah) Camps
Atareb 639 HHs (Al Raay, Batebo, Ziytan , Al Tal) Camps Interventions will target the same beneficiaries as follow: NFI Distributing e-voucher with $150 value to redeem it with heating items for 3 months, where monthly $50 will be loaded. Firstly, Takaful will conduct meetings with local actors to ensure their participation in the project. The fuel vendors will be selected according to certain criteria. As we already work with e-voucher vendors in some of the targeted locations in another project funded by HF , that will support our efficient and fast implementation for this project. Beneficiaries will be selected among the most vulnerable (male-female). The voucher distribution will be on pre-identified dates and in safe points with easy access. Instead of physical training, as a response to Covid, an explanatory video will be prepared and shared with benes, includes how to redeem vouchers, vendors' names and addresses, WtsApp number for complaints, in addition to banners describes the redemption process and vendors’ information. After ensuring that the beneficiaries have redeemed their vouchers from the vendors, the value of the items will be paid to the vendors. For HHs who face difficulties in reaching the markets, we will deliver their vouchers to their locations, and giving them the chance to choose kinds of provided items they prefer and then delivering it to their locations. We chose the voucher modality as it is easier to use and follow up, and gives the beneficiaries the choice to buy what they want from multiple vendors to avoid the risks of fuel storage, where the beneficiaries will visit the selected vendors shops and choose the heating items they need. CCCM We will establish fire response committee (males and females) in the targeted camps in order to mitigate the risks of occurring fire, in addition to best response to fire when it occur. We will provide capacity development to committees and camp management staff to response to fire through the training on using of fire response items. In addition, Takaful team will prepare an awareness video and e-brochures explaining the prevention advices to avoid fire, and how to use fire response items in case fire occurred to raise the awareness of camp residents. In coordination with camps’ management and fire response committees in targeted camps, fire points will be putted in suitable locations, where each 140 tents will be provided with fire point includes fire response items The trained committees will transfer the training to the camps’ residents. We will insist on prevention procedures for COVID-19 before, during and after the distribution, including distancing, procedures of sterilization staff and beneficiaries, awareness posters, crowds management, sterilizing DPs according to WASH amp health cluster’s recommendations in addition to allocate an employee to monitor and make sure that all COVID-19 prevention procedures were applied. We will coordinate with CCCM and NFI clusters and other organizations to avoid any duplication. The project will ensure equal access for both genders with priority for women, children headed household, PwD, sick and elderly in addition the project staff female and male members trained on the protection and gander equality
